1.text: Knewest thou the time of the bringing forth of the wild goats of the rock? and wilt thou watch the bearing of the hinds?

2.text: Wilt thou number the months they shall fill up? and didst thou know the time of their bringing forth?

3.text: They will bow, they will bring forth their children, they will cast forth their pains.

4.text: Their sons will be fat, they will increase with grain; they will go forth and not turn back to them.

5.text: Who sent the wild ass free? and who opened the bonds of the wild ass?

6.text: To whom did I set the desert his house, and the salt land his dwellings?

7.text: He will laugh at the multitude of the city; he will not hear the noise of him driving.

8.text: The searching out of the mountains his pasture, and he will seek after every green thing.

9.text: Will the buffalo be willing to serve thee, or will he lodge by thy stall?

10.text: Wilt thou bind the buffalo in the furrow with cords, or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

11.text: Wilt thou trust in him because great his strength? and wilt thou leave to him thy labor?

12.text: Wilt thou believe in him that he will turn back thy seed and gather to thy threshing-floor?

13.text: The wings of ostriches exulted; and the wing-feather of the stork and the pinion.

14.text: For she will leave her eggs to the earth, and she will warm them in the dust;

15.text: And she will forget that the foot will press it, and the beast of the field will crush it.

16.text: She made hard to her sons as not to her: her labor in vain without fear;

17.text: For God caused her to forget wisdom, and he divided not to her in understanding.

18.text: For the time she will lash herself up upon height, she will laugh at the horse and at his rider.

19.text: Wilt thou give strength to the horse? wilt thou clothe his neck with thunder?

20.text: Wilt thou cause him to tremble as the locust? the glory of his snorting is terror.

21.text: They will dig in the valley, and he will rejoice in strength: he will go forth to the meeting of the weapon.

22.text: He will laugh at fear, and he will not be dismayed; and he will not turn back from the face of the sword.

23.text: The quiver will give forth a whizzing against him, the flame of the spear and the javelin.

24.text: With leaping and rage he will swallow the earth; and he will not believe that it is the voice of the trumpet.

25.text: He will say according to the multitude of the trumpet, Aha! and he will smell the battle from far off, the thunder of the chiefs, and the war cry.

26.text: From thy understanding will the hawk mount upwards? will it stretch its wings to the south?

27.text: If at thy mouth the eagle will lift itself up, and if it will raise up its nest?

28.text: She will dwell in the rock, and she will lodge upon the cliff of the rock and the fortress.

29.text: From thence it sought food; far off shall its eyes behold.

30.text: Her young shall suck up the blood: and where the wounded, there is she.
